website_summaries.verdict: If you're looking for the ultimate cleaning robot, this self-mapping, surprisingly strong, and allergen-trapping Roomba is the best model on the market.
pros: Filter catches 99% of mold, allergens, and dust
40 times as powerful as a Roomba 600
cons: This is the priciest Roomba iRobot produces

customer_reviews.title: shoe fetish
customer_reviews.text: My Roomba is a perv. The second I turn it on, it beelines across the entire apartment to disappear into my wife’s closet. Every. Single. Time. It’s the only room it will vacuum properly. Creepy AF, however, I’ll grant it 2stars for its admirable tenacity.
customer_reviews.author: Jac

customer_reviews.title: Keeps getting stuck
customer_reviews.text: video says it all. this super expensive junk does not even clean 1 inches. Called up irobot customer support and they sent a replacement device (Incident: 190719-003160) . Replacement device gave the same error, opened another case ( [Incident: 190726-002073]. They could not solve my problem for several days which involved multiple reboot/factory reset, fancy button press etc. Inspite of telling them that this seems to be a software issue they wanted to send me one more replacement. Thats when i decided to send it back.
customer_reviews.author: souvik ghosh

customer_reviews.title: Will not work with rugs on hardwood!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely will not work with rugs laying on hardwoods. Try's to push them up instead of going over them. If you don't mind picking up your rugs so it can work, this is the unit for you. For what it cost, it should work with rugs but no way shape or form does it.
customer_reviews.author: C L

customer_reviews.title: Horrible experience
customer_reviews.text: This Roomba never like a first generator. Look good technology but is not working properly. At 4:00 a.m start a noise like a finish work. Then do not working or cleaning, using manual or Apps. The noise lasted after one hour. Also the edge brush damage so early. The IRobot company describe a edge brush to replace after 3 month, but its not a really. Only work two clean and brush damage. In overall, this machine is a waste money. Its a lot expensive over $1,200 and Roomba old version working much better and cost $250 to $350. I'm so disappointment and upset with this product.
customer_reviews.author: edwinupr

customer_reviews.title: AVOID - SELF CLEAN BASE DOES NOT WORK - iROBOT REFUSE TO HELP
customer_reviews.text: The Self Clean function on the base unit DID NOT WORK straight out of the box. Robot itself works fine but the significantly higher premium price you pay for the self cleaning function is NOT WORTH IT. Contacted iRobot support who refused to help and referred me back to Amazon. iRobot acknowledged it needs replacing but refused to honour warranty as I live overseas. I even offered to pay all shipping costs but they still refused. Avoid this Company and their non working products like the plague.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Brand new and not working
customer_reviews.text: Not working right out of the box. Will not Detect that the lid is closed. Worked with iRobot help and now they are sending me another to replace this one. Very disappointed but still have high hopes that I will get a working robot.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: no programming
customer_reviews.text: I used it like my 980 to clean my house, it lost programming every other day had to run it over and over would get hung on places it worked on for days, go to a wall spend its battery trying to climb wall. Generaly a failuire.
customer_reviews.author: Dwight H. Gregg

customer_reviews.title: Beware if you plan to use this machine on carpet.
customer_reviews.text: Had this unit for 8 weeks. One month past the return window. Total investment over $2000 with two additional bases. The vacuum stopped working, throwing errors about needing to be serviced or cleaned. After multiple conversations with iRobot customer service, it was determined the machine wouldn't work on our carpet. It was "too thick". I've included a picture of the carpet, so judge for yourself whether it's the carpet or a poorly designed machine. To their credit, iRobot offered to accept returns on the two extra base units.
customer_reviews.author: Meagvg

customer_reviews.title: I will wait till they iron out the bugs.
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes. Currently it leaves the docking platform, turns red and says it needs to be rebooted. When it did work it had a 20% return successfully. Mostly I had to find it around the house just stalled for no reason. Wanted to get this for a vacation home, but the amount of baby sitting it needs, I think I can service is better with a broom and vacuum. Sending this garbage back.
customer_reviews.author: Guy Brand

customer_reviews.title: If you can afford it, you should get it.
customer_reviews.text: If you can afford it, this one makes your life easy. The mapping feature is a great plus. Adding keep out areas adds improved control. For iRobot: your next version needs to come with camera so it doesn’t look dumb bumping constantly on walls. Min 2 low res cameras will not break your bottom line.
customer_reviews.author: Zi

customer_reviews.title: Worked for about 11 seconds before it broke
customer_reviews.text: Set up and charged the iRobot. Started it up and it worked for 11 seconds before it stopped, flashed a red light and basically died. I followed all of the troubleshooting and then called Customer Service. I was on the phone with them for half hour and the lady wasn't very helpful or professional. After painstakingly -and unsuccessfully - going through their protocol I returned this item. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Casey

customer_reviews.title: Pos
customer_reviews.text: Worst robot ever . Gets stuck in the same spot every time ( empty corner ) . It also makes maps of the home that are false . Have a map that goes like 3 miles into my back yard then probably into my neighbors yard . I robot will not refund or replace and keep me on the line for another solution that does not work . I imagine this is to wait for my warranty to expire . Total pos . Do not buy
customer_reviews.author: Jackson S.

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy! Was loyal customer, now I will never buy from irobot
customer_reviews.text: Bad product, and poor QC. Didn’t even work out of the box. Had to return for full refund. So much trouble to bring back from the States to Singapore and had to pay expensive courier fees to return. Very disappointed!!!
customer_reviews.author: Ivy T.

customer_reviews.title: Just a great product.
customer_reviews.text: This Roomba S9+ is a welcome addition to our house. The ability to clean any combination of rooms is a great feature. Our main floor is about 1500 square feet and it can clean the whole house on one charge. Our floors are tile and we have several area rugs. It cleans all without any problem. The self-emptying feature is a real labor saver. Be prepared to be patient at first when the Roomba is mapping your floor plan. This is a little time consuming; but once the mapping is finished the Roomba cleans quickly and efficiently. The ability to control the Roomba from your mobile phone is a great feature.
customer_reviews.author: Jaime G

customer_reviews.title: irobot needs to thoroughly test there products before embarrassing themselves.
customer_reviews.text: pros: vacuum works well, gets into carpets well (when it’s not eating them), not overly aggressive on furniture with recent update, looks nice cons: annoying and loud only works with lights on or daytime battery is bad on max loves to get stuck even inside keep-out areas EXPENSIVE for what it is (waaay overpriced even at 1000$) probably will not ever be an irobot customer again, and i really really wanted to like this, and the M6, sent them both back because they just don’t work. or last long with how much they bang themselves up
customer_reviews.author: Vinny

customer_reviews.title: It was nice when it worked
customer_reviews.text: The product stopped working during the first week and had to be returned. It did do a nice job during the brief time it worked though.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It sucks... Get it?
customer_reviews.text: Was a little buggy at first. Did a factory reset and it doesn't have anymore mapping issues.
customer_reviews.author: Eric porter

customer_reviews.title: Never finishes it's job
customer_reviews.text: Battery lasts about 1 hour 40 minutes. It never finishes even the small portion of our house that I have closed off. Then, it can't find its way back home on its own.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Best Purchase This Year!!! Amazing Machine
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant to buy based on the price $1,400. This amazing machine cleans over 2,000 sq ft flawlessly. It mapped the layout perfectly and works efficiently. It self empties and returns to base to charge - it requires no attention. It has freed-up my day tremendously. We have 3 large dogs, one of which is a fuzz-making machine. There is no trace of massive hair tumble weeds or dirt debris. Only con is that it is loud, but it does the work. Best purchase this year!!!
customer_reviews.author: ADJones

customer_reviews.title: 2 Units I received Were Defective
customer_reviews.text: After trying two times I give up and will try another robot vacuum because this one clearly is not ready for prime time! Don't waste your money!
customer_reviews.author: Houdini

customer_reviews.title: Did not work on dark floors
customer_reviews.text: We have had iRobot Roomba for years and decided to get this new model. It did not work on dark floors. We worked with Roomba Customer Service to try to get it to work but there was no solution.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Unless you have all wood floors with no rugs...NO!!!!
customer_reviews.text: PLEASE do not waste your hard earned money on this!!! Unless you have all hard wood / tile floor. We have a 9x7 rug is our living room that is ALWAYS gets stuck on. ALWAYS!! Called customer support and there’s “smart maps” and a “keep out zone”. We tried that. We even mapped it out exactly (even thought we would have to manually vacuum the rug with our dyson) but it still didn’t work. It’s just go right over it and get stuck. This smart robot vacuums is so not very smart. Definitely not $1299 worth of smart.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Trea Smith

customer_reviews.title: We call him Bradley
customer_reviews.text: Tireless little worker. Never complains. He did a great job of mapping our house, and now goes about his chores with great efficiency. The Roomba is not cheap, but it does its job well.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Brown

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: For the price, this product is absolutely not worth it. It constantly gets stuck on things even though the house is kept in decent order and will just run out of battery in a random room at times. Tech support wasn't helpful either. The best they had to offer was move the home base about 15 feet down the hall so the robot didn't have to go as far. The robot running out of battery half way through a job is definitely a technically flaw. It should go back to the home base, recharge, and then finish the job. Overall, very disappointed in this product.
customer_reviews.author: Ben M.

customer_reviews.title: Best help for pet owners & high traffic areas
customer_reviews.text: As of this writing our S9+ has cleaned 17,100 Sq, Ft. since June 10, 2019. It has picked up an amazing amount of pet hair during that time. It makes a scheduled daily pass over the high traffic areas, especially the entrance where stuff gets tracked in. It also makes a weekly pass in other areas to keep things in check. Especially true in the bedroom where it can easily get the dust and dirt from under the bed. Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Paul W.

customer_reviews.title: Huge waste of time and money.
customer_reviews.text: Don’t buy on amazon from iRobot directly, retuns are a mess. No wonder they are so pricey, my guess it’s to recover the amount of returns or broken ones. It took three times to get one that actually works. It still has issue with docking but at least it runs for now. iRobot customer service is ok, could be better. So to sum it up, don’t buy.
customer_reviews.author: Russell Richards

customer_reviews.title: Always finds a way to fail.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this when I was in a small apartment, and it had trouble with everything it encountered. Taped down wires, low pile rugs, everything. I took significant steps to modify my layout and wire placement to make the Roomba work. It never did. Later, I moved to a bigger house, that was completely flat, and while it was still empty, I tried training Roomba. It ended up getting stuck in empty corners of wood floored rooms, and on the rails of sliding doors. This product is a joke, and the punchline is that I cannot get my money back.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Herz

customer_reviews.title: Not worth spending $1000
customer_reviews.text: When I got to know about this product I looked at some of the videos online and thought it will be good. But I can say that its not worth $1000. It has done multiple damage to my home. And it can't work without supervision at all. This robot cant be left alone to work. It always gets lost and not able to find the home. If this was a $200-$300 product I can still bear with it's not worth $1000 at all. Sorry but I am very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Roshan

customer_reviews.title: Garbage in robot form
customer_reviews.text: Do not waste your money on this Roomba. Was excited after finally splurging on the top of the line model only to have it not work straight from the box. Kept giving an error about the bumper. Called Roomba, they sent out a replacement, it arrived about 5 days later, and it said that the battery wouldn’t charge. We also discovered that the replacement sent from Roomba was previously used and had hair in it. Totally unacceptable for the amount of money this costs. Sent back for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Audrey L Millot

customer_reviews.title: Overpriced & almost worthless
customer_reviews.text: Purchased the Roomba s9+ in July 2019 at a cost of $1200+. There have been numerous bugs and programming problems over these 7 months. My Roomba now will not operate more than a few minutes before it shuts down (showing Error 31) and requires repeated rebooting. After rebooting, it repeats the error. This Roomba s9+ does not even begin to come close to working like a $1200 piece of equipment! A complete waste of money!
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous 210

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money if you hate to vacuum!
customer_reviews.text: I am pleased with this new model. It seems to clean as well as our full size manual vacuums. Actually better because it gets under things. I gave the noise level a 5 because for the suction it offers I don't believe it could be any quieter but it is nevertheless fairly noisy. The mapping features work well and I feel it is well worth the cost. We had help for my wife who hates to vacuum but with our isolation during this pandemic (we are 73) we don't allow anyone to come into our home which is why I bought 2 S9's. One for downstairs and one for upstairs. I would recommend them to anyone who hates to vacuum!
customer_reviews.author: Nick Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Does not work..: avoid!
customer_reviews.text: Did not work at all for me. It is not intelligent at all - keeps going back to the same place over and over. The mapping is sadly quite pathetic. The maps it created look nothing like our house or floor plans. Lastly, it kept getting stuck. Had high hopes for this. But returned it after a week of trying to make it work. Not at all worth what it costs!
customer_reviews.author: Sanket S Nesargi

customer_reviews.title: New member of our cleanup crew
customer_reviews.text: “Woody”, our Roomba, was able to map our entire 1st floor (all hardwood except for dining room rug) in two sessions. My wife who is an anti- gadget person now welcomes it as a helper. She has a regimen to dust, straighten, etc. then sends Woody to task to follow her. We also have a 900 series Roomba but this new guy on the block doesn’t require relocation of start points, setting of electronic fences, or manually emptying of bin. Yes, it is a bit pricey but the excellent “sweet” results by far justify the short lived bitterness of the initial constantly fading cost. We now have over 180 cleanings and are still very pleased with its ease of use.
customer_reviews.author: Ken Vagen

customer_reviews.title: Great robot vac
customer_reviews.text: We have an 11yo Yellow Lab that is kept indoors. She is sweet as honey, but sheds hair constantly. Before we purchased iRobot Roomba s9+, we spent much of our time picking up hair with various brooms, vacuums, etc. And we still didn't do an adequate job as hair fins its way into corners and under stationary objects and furniture. Now we just turn the iRobot Roomba s9+ and let it do its thing.
customer_reviews.author: Elite_Lawn

customer_reviews.title: Love this thing, now need something for dusting
customer_reviews.text: I had a few issues with first purchase but irobot took care of me and replaced everything no cost to me. Roomba #2 runs like a charm and the auto bin empty is fantastic, not to mention the link the the mop and smart map
customer_reviews.author: LoveAmazon

customer_reviews.title: Worst vacuum to date
customer_reviews.text: Uneven ground... constantly. Uneven ground over and over and over and over. Contacted customer care, they want pictures of my house, pictures of my space, everything. Just returning. This model is horrible
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas

customer_reviews.title: Glad I waited this long for the right Robot vaccum cleaner
customer_reviews.text: S9 Plus is absolutely incredible. It took me less than 5 minutes to unpack and get it going. 2 training rounds and the Roomba was all set. It did an amazing job of mapping our 4500 square feet house and it took me less than 10 minutes to mark out all the rooms with the absolutely intuitive interface. Really happy with the first couple of learning rounds the S0 Plus completed. What a delightful combination of sensors and IoT, AI, Mechatronics , aesthetics. Great job by iRobot. If you are on the look out and don't mind the price tag ( It sure is absolutely expensive), go for the S9 Plus....
customer_reviews.author: a n rao

customer_reviews.title: Excellent vacuum
customer_reviews.text: We have had this Roomba for about 2 months now. Our house is mostly hardwood with large area rugs. It cleans well and has no problems navigating different surfaces. It even cleans under the couches and coffee tables and chairs with no problems. It rarely gets stuck and when it does it's usually due to something we've left in the way like a cord. The self emptying dust bin is very nice and works well.
customer_reviews.author: Russell Sudbury

customer_reviews.title: Nice Combo Set
customer_reviews.text: Got this set for a great price. Included the Braava Jet and the total price was the same as if I just purchased the Roomba. So, the Braava Jet was basically free. The Braava Jet maps and runs great. The Roomba has some issues with getting lost in a room and not cleaning the entire room. Is only an issue in one room for some reason. It functions great in all other rooms.
customer_reviews.author: EVERC

customer_reviews.title: Worth it.
customer_reviews.text: Love this iRobot. We use it everyday as we have two dogs. We’ve had an iRobot before which was decent but it missed areas and didn’t work well on carpet. This iRobot hits almost every open square inch and goes over rugs really well. I love that you can see where it’s been and if you want tell it where to clean. Only downfall is it’s super loud.
customer_reviews.author: Erica

customer_reviews.title: Arrived Broken
customer_reviews.text: i guess it happens, but my Roomba S9 was dead on arrival. Roomba is shipping a replacement, but disappointing to expect a new expensive gadget and have it not work immediately.. will update this review when fixed.
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t last more than about 2 months
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this unit in February 2020, around end of March it wouldn’t complete a full vacuum of the area without error’s. Contacted iRobot and they sent a replacement. The replacement is already doing the same thing. Very unhappy about this unit. Love the self emptying part of this unit and it does a fantastic job cleaning when it works.
customer_reviews.author: Scott O.

customer_reviews.title: Powerful with suction but easily got problem
customer_reviews.text: After less than 2 days’ service, this SUPER EXPENSIVE JUNK gave up! I was surprised by the suction power when it works! Got 4 dogs home and desperately need it to release my hands for every day cleaning. When it works, it gorgeous! Even it easily got stuck with things on the floor. I called and did exactly what I was told but it still keeps backing up and spinning as in video. For dogs sake, I was going to give it one more try and get a replacement, guess what, surprisely, replacement is not an option, finally end up with return! Huge disappointment! I guess I’ll still stuck with my 985, for technology, S9 still not there yet.
customer_reviews.author: Unique4949

customer_reviews.title: Died in 12 hours!
customer_reviews.text: Wow I hoped the reviews on this thing were exceptions but not 12hrs into having it and it won’t work with iRobot unable to figure out why. I’ve had to join video to show them it not working. I’ve had to take it apart on the phone. Nothing now I’m on hold. I rarely write reviews, but given all the other bad reviews I feel compelled to confirm what others have already said and that is this Roomba has a ton of problems and buy only with extreme caution.
customer_reviews.author: T. Crews

customer_reviews.title: Good job or a but not for the price
customer_reviews.text: This vacuum does a good job at picking up minimal pet hair, however, I did have to go over the areas that had rugs/carpet with a regular Dyson vacuum to get all of the dirt and hair. This would be fine for me if it weren't so expensive. I would rather just continue to vacuum often vs have a superficial intermediate clean that costs me over $1000.
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: requires a lot of attention
customer_reviews.text: cleans carpet much better than the shark , cannot get through a cleaning without a problem , do not waste your money on the automatic dirt bin as it requires attention after every cleaning , it has problems staying connected to wi-fi , mapping works far better than the shark except for the wi-fi problems , then mapping fails , shark has much better battery life .
customer_reviews.author: 1-2 mini teQulias

customer_reviews.title: Like having a cleaning lady more than just once a week
customer_reviews.text: What a great machine. It keeps our house clean but more importantly cleans of all the dog fur. I am so very happy not to have to see the fur, nor vacuum it myself. We have mapped out the house and programmed it to work when, where and how often we felt necessary per week. We programmed it to clean the kitchen floor every night at 9:30 pm. Every room is programmable. It doesn't clog and it is quiet. It doesn't bother my high strung dog. Now that's a plus. I love love it. I then went and purchase the floor mop iRobot Braava Jet M6. (very pleased too). Now if they can just make one to clean the toilets.
customer_reviews.author: Louise F.

customer_reviews.title: Does not Work
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I purchased this vacuum because had one that we purchased from Best Buy, figured Amazons would be no cheaper. We've had this product for 1 month and it does not work. It does not charge, we have changed parts and it still does not vacuum the carpet. Very disappointment and really want my money back.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Horrible Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: Save your money and choose another brand. Have been in contact with customer support several times for the same issue and the problem is still not resolved due to customer support errors and misinformation. By the time this is resolved I will have been without the vacuum for over a month.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Too soon to tell but not good so far
customer_reviews.text: Seems like the battery might be going out already. It has only been a month and it can't do the bottom floor on one charge anymore, also it can't seem to find it's base as well. I don't know what's happening with it. Might have to factory reset it and see if that helps
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: I love this vacuum. It has saved me so much time. It cleans easily and does get stuck sometimes but I think it’s still learning. It’s easy to clean and maintain your self without having to go to a vacuum shop every 6 months.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander Hoffman

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy it.
customer_reviews.text: Doesn’t work. Goes in circles. Tech support keep asking if we have enough light. I will try again tomorrow. If they can’t fix it I want to return this expensive piece of garbage. Too bad that zero stars is not an option.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Novik

customer_reviews.title: Super easy set up on I Phone and simple to command from anywhere with wifi
customer_reviews.text: we have multiple surfaces, wood, carpet and tile IRobot Roomba s9+ has no problem at the transitions between surfaces and you do hear the motor kick up when it moves from a smooth surface to the carpeted areas. in addition have a stairwell going to basement and it senses the stairs and wont fall down them so that's pretty amazing does a great job and you can program what days and areas you need cleaned after you have some history of use and have created and saved some maps of the previous cleaning jobs
customer_reviews.author: Phyllis Cain

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money - Not intelligent at all
customer_reviews.text: There is absolutely nothing that justifies the price of this robot vacuum. Takes 3.5 hours (1.5 charging and 2 cleaning) for 700 sq ft. It gets lost and stuck all the time. After it has finally build a map it still gets lost and even redraws maps if you need to move it after it gets stuck. Probably the worst piece of technology I have bought in the last years. Also very noisy.
customer_reviews.author: Valdimar Bragason

customer_reviews.title: Terrible Warranty Program
customer_reviews.text: Stay away from iRobot products they don't deliver on their warranty. It seems they don't stand behind their ultra expensive products, after less than 90 days of having bought their latest and most expensive model, the Clean Base broke down and wont work. Customer Support said it most be replace but they are not honoring the warranty. Stay away!
customer_reviews.author: Juan D. Cardoze

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money so far.
customer_reviews.text: An absolute joke of a product so far. The lid is always saying that it needs to be closed, even though it is making the product unusable. And I’ve contacted customer support multiple times and haven’t had anything resolved. For a expensive product customer service should be replacing bad products instantly.
customer_reviews.author: tom baker

customer_reviews.title: Worth it, but needs tlc to operate well over time.
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love the convenience of it! Issues we have had though, are a few - so order the replacement parts so you have them on hand. 1. The rollers somehow split and bent - due to long hair rolled up in it perhaps / or a string perhaps? 2. The vacuum finds all sorts of stuff when you aren’t vacuuming personally and watching what it picks up. Loose an earring? Enjoy searching a gross bag - but, you just might find it! 3. The battery life is a joke and replacement batteries are expensive ($86 for brand). But - all in all, it’s worth it!!! And it does a fantastic job mapping the house and working off an iPhone.
customer_reviews.author: Erin Rose

customer_reviews.title: Semi DOA on arrival.
customer_reviews.text: My iRobot performed flawlessly out of the box until it returned home. Then it did not empty. I rebooted the beast and then it stopped in a certain area of our kitchen and threw a code31. Restated again and it threw another code 31 in the same location as last time. Rebooted with the help of iRobot Tech support returned it home and it still did not empty. Finally I gave up and returned it. You would think that for $1,399 they would QA all the units leaving the factory. I guess I will try a Shark next.
customer_reviews.author: RoyEdK

customer_reviews.title: Not charging... not able to connect to app
customer_reviews.text: I could not get it started....it was dead tried to change it ...nothing. I love it but sending it back maybe this is just a lemon
customer_reviews.author: Susana Robledo

customer_reviews.title: Biggest headache
customer_reviews.text: This is the dumbest robot on the face of the planet. I can count the number of times its worked on one hand in the 8 months that I have owned it. The first one wouldn't even turn on out of the box so we had to trade it in for a new one. Most of the time it won't leave its 5ftx5ft corner that its base is in, then comes up with an error. Its become a weight that sits in our leaving room that I vacuum around with our $100 vacuum from Walmart. Would not recommend to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon stiles

customer_reviews.title: Should be called iFrustrateyou
customer_reviews.text: This thing is so frustrating. Could be good but does not work. We have owned several of these. This one won’t even clean when you physically press the clean button. I don’t understand how they can make such a bad product.
customer_reviews.author: Cory

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after a month of use (Edited)
customer_reviews.text: Damn thing suddenly got issues: can't connect to internet after a month of use. Staying a week on base station and has 10% of charge? Really. Cheap china part and labor. My others 2 old irobots (3 and 6 years old) work better than this new a month old crap. Contacted support. Had to reset sofware. Seems works. Give it 3 starts, not sure whether it's issue with memory or bad software, but really - have to reset to fix isue with wifi these days?
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: A REAL TIME SAVER
customer_reviews.text: Love this device, it does a thorough amazing job. We use it just on hardwood and tile floors. It really works well. It saves me time on a daily basis as I was always sweeping the floors. Even if the tile floor needs to be washed, it thoroughly removes loose debris. I would highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Audiology

customer_reviews.title: Best in class
customer_reviews.text: Major improvements over the roomba 980. Outstanding vacuuming and easy to use. Maybe once a month care. A must for household robotics.
customer_reviews.author: Wy

customer_reviews.title: Completely stopped working after a couple months
customer_reviews.text: It worked great for the first couple months. Now, every time I try to run it, it stops and reports "error 31". I've tried resetting it multiple times with no success. I have another iRobot machine which works fine, so the network is not the issue. Unfortunately it's an unusable $1000 piece of plastic now. I looked into getting a replacement, but apparently they're backordered with no estimated date. 2 stars because it was great before it became a brick.
customer_reviews.author: Kurt Kotzur

customer_reviews.title: English Mastiff sheds a dog a day.
customer_reviews.text: I have an English Mastiff that sheds a dog a day. This vacuum keeps up great. First bag lasted a over a month. Empties itself every time no problem. I can choose to vacuum the whole house or just go to one room. I have all hardwood floors.
customer_reviews.author: MIKE COLLINS

customer_reviews.title: Works Good but..
customer_reviews.text: The brushes cost over 45$ to replace, they are way to soft and fall apart with long hair cutting into it. The front brush also falls apart way to fast. They should give free replacements tell they fix this problem
customer_reviews.author: Noob

customer_reviews.title: I am amazed by how well it performs.
customer_reviews.text: This little robot has an amazing mapping program. Very easy to setup and use. It does require a bit of maintenance (more so than a regular vacuum ) but it does do a great job picking up the dog hair. A few problems getting stuck on an area rug that has tassels on it. I may cut the tassels off and see if that works. Over all I am very pleased with it’s performance.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas K. Marple

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money if you have some to spare
customer_reviews.text: After having the Neato botvac d4 for about a year we decided to get an upgrade. The Roomba s9+ Will rarely have any issues, with the only issues being that it have clean the brushes when something gets in it. It’s carpet cleaning is phenomenal and the amount of cleaning options are very useful. The only problems I’ve faced are friends that think it’s magical and that it’s stupid that I will suck up a sock or run over cables.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle B.

customer_reviews.title: Error code 9
customer_reviews.text: It gets stuck within the first minute and states error code 9. Tech support at Roomba are of no help as all they do over the phone is read the steps in the instruction manual. After spending over $1400, this was pathetic. I am still willing to give them the benefit of doubt and having it exchanged hoping that this was a one off defective item.
customer_reviews.author: S. Afridi

customer_reviews.title: The new design with Roller in front is bad!
customer_reviews.text: I had the i7+ and the suction rollers were located at the middle of the unit. That made it easier to climb over rugs and not get stuck, because it was using the weight in front to leverage. The s9+ design is not good at all. The suction rollers are at the front and it vibrates on rugs because of that, plus it gets stuck easier, it does not have the weight in front to smooth out the ride on the rugs.
customer_reviews.author: David M.

customer_reviews.title: Requires frequent intervention -- Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to help reduce the time I spend vacuuming... needless to say I spend the same amount of time "fixing" all of the issues it encounters and touching up missed spots. Definitely not worth the price tag. I wish I could return it but I waited too long.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Gotta see it to believe it!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Use it every day works like you would not believe. It's amazing, when it's full it goes back and empties itself and back it goes. Same thing happens when the battery gets low it goes back to its base and recharges
customer_reviews.author: Chris Miller

customer_reviews.title: Love My Roomba s9+ 9(9550)
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't sure I really needed the Roomba, but once I saw what it did I was more than excited about having it! It can get into areas I can't. I am so glad I got the upgraded model. It self-empties which I love. It's so convenient! I highly recommend paying more, but getting the perfect model right off the bat! Other friends and neighbors who bought the less expensive ones wish they had bought the one I have. LuAnn
customer_reviews.author: Louise A Scaramella

customer_reviews.title: this model is doing exactly what I expected....even more
customer_reviews.text: It took 2 days for the Roomba to map our 1800 sf home. Felt like we had a new roommate ☺️. afterward we were able to mark the rooms and then clean each room as necessary. The vacuum did get stuck between some support legs under the bed so I was able to block off a small portion underneath the bed. Very cool! I love it. I can do one room or 2 rooms or the entire house. If there is a problem you get noticed on the app. very few problems and getting better as he learns the house. 5 stars on this purchase. a little noisy but any vacuum is noisy.....nice having another roommate!
customer_reviews.author: diana phillips

customer_reviews.title: Need to keep resetting lid after vacuuming
customer_reviews.text: Initially very impressed but after 1 week, now the lid needs to be reset after every vacuum. So much for $1000 and hands off! Tech support seems very difficult.
customer_reviews.author: Steve B

customer_reviews.title: Navigation is great but my cat hates it.
customer_reviews.text: Pricey but great. Doesn't slam into things once properly mapped. Being able to tell it to clean a specific room without those line cut off cubes is great. Love the bin too.
customer_reviews.author: Mason

customer_reviews.title: Pretty loud, but I guess that means it's working better than my Eufy
customer_reviews.text: I also have a Eufy but wanted something with smart mapping and a bin because I was tired of emptying mine everyday. This thing is probably twice as loud, but it appears to have more suction, based on the vacuum tracks over a high pile rug we have. I also love the smart mapping rather than just going in random places.
customer_reviews.author: bc

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy it and receive garbage.
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy it and receive garbage. Ordered abroad, but the goods that cannot be used normally are sent. High unit price, completely unusable garbage. After turning on, it will only rotate in place, and then immediately notify "tap the sensor, then press the CLEAN key". There is no repair, and foreign orders cannot process returns or send repairs.
customer_reviews.author: Cheng Yung-Hsin

customer_reviews.title: High end
customer_reviews.text: iRobot Roomba s9+ (9550) Robot Vacuum with Automatic Dirt Disposal- Empties itself, Wi-Fi Connected. I bought and had to return it and the Echo Dot. It was so hard to hook it up to the internet and get it started.
customer_reviews.author: Clarita

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I love having something that can vacuum all the dog fur up on a daily basis or as needed. Really easy to program. Only thing is that it is pretty noisy.. not something you’d probably have running while you are sleeping or trying to watch TV because of the noise.
customer_reviews.author: Misty

customer_reviews.title: If you have carpet or stairs, this is not for you
customer_reviews.text: If you have carpet, or stairs this is not really for you. It always pops the Rmba is near a cliff or request for your assistance... I7+ performance much better
customer_reviews.author: Zhirong HUANG

customer_reviews.title: Expensive and unreliable
customer_reviews.text: The mapping feature doesn’t work. Tried twice, even with removing obstacles. It refused to go right of its docking station. Expensive and unreliable
customer_reviews.author: misha

customer_reviews.title: Not always as described
customer_reviews.text: Like - cleaned very well when it worked. Got stuck several times and ran out of battery power - died on the spot. Went over the edge of a carpeted stair and lost battery power as well. Also got stuck under our Viking stove and a china cabinet - couldn't get out.
customer_reviews.author: john h.

customer_reviews.title: Life saver!
customer_reviews.text: Blown away by this vacuum! I have a German shepherd and I was literally a slave to vacuuming! This is truly a life saver and my floors looks amazing!! More time with my family!
customer_reviews.author: Terry Y.

customer_reviews.title: Best buy for vacuuming hater!!
customer_reviews.text: 112 jobs completed: 32,700 sf cleaned in just under 75 hours so far (since February 2020)... LOVE our roomba s9+. Program the day, time, rooms, order of cleaning... swap out the cleaning station bag every few weeks. Best. Purchase.Ever.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Hair Gobbler is a BEAST!  3 Dogs and a Cat.  Wood Floors, Carpet & Tile.
customer_reviews.text: Hair Gobbler is a BEAST! 3 Dogs and a Cat. Wood Floors, Carpet & Tile. We come home to a pet hair free house every day. We would definitely recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Greg N

customer_reviews.title: Makes life easier
customer_reviews.text: This product is amazing! Suction is fantastic, it gets in to corners and next to furniture, and covers the entire room. I can turn this on and leave the house knowing the vacuuming will be complete when I return.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: So far I love it
customer_reviews.text: Cleans great, my first Roomba hopefully it will continue to preform as it has this past month. So far it has completed 52 jobs, total of 14 hours 38 minutes. We have 2 large dogs, cleans the one room that we have carpet in better then my Kirby, never would have believed that.
customer_reviews.author: MarCar

customer_reviews.title: I have three dogs and people don't even know it.
customer_reviews.text: I own 4 roombas. This one is fantastic and if you have a 980 buying this one allows you to schedule your 980 with your Brava M6 Mop. A feature that roomba did not have before.
customer_reviews.author: bernard

customer_reviews.title: It doesn't work as they sell it
customer_reviews.text: does not work well, it gets out of control, and it turns off being out of its base
customer_reviews.author: Luis Diaz

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied
customer_reviews.text: Had it for almost a month so far very satisfied works way better then previous models grids better maps better quieter gets the house done much faster then previous model and better job aswell and loved the self emptying! So far very happy didnt rate tech support because I haven't needed so couldn't honestly say however if it's anything like the product I'm sure I would be pleased
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Horrible tech support—your on your own!!!
customer_reviews.text: $900 plus vacuum does not work from the beginning. Been charging for 5 plus hours and nothing happens except white light going in circles. No other lights functioning. The IRobot support center was incredibly bad—it’s as if they do not even know the product
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Gabrione

customer_reviews.title: Lack of Wall Barrier
customer_reviews.text: Everything is good except package doesn't including Wall Barrier!!!! DO NOT Recommend if you live in multi-floor because you have to spend extra $$ to purchase their Wall Barriers before they fail underground.
customer_reviews.author: ChaseT

customer_reviews.title: WoW dint know it could be this easy
customer_reviews.text: once it roamed the house cleaning one then twice it knows the house and does a great job on hard wood and carpets we have 2 dogs that shed and it cleans it up perfectly
customer_reviews.author: Henry Miller

customer_reviews.title: Expensive but worth it!
customer_reviews.text: Our house is almost entirely 1 level hardwood floors... this cleans ever inch incredibly well and has saved my fiance from having to vacuum even once since we got it 6 months ago. The thing is amazing and worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Russell

customer_reviews.title: It is fragile! Lots of cleaning of filters to do.
customer_reviews.text: Never even used it. Icloud was continually busy. There's no manual back up either. My return has not been processed?
customer_reviews.author: 2020Id83669

customer_reviews.title: Worth it got this family.
customer_reviews.text: A powerful vacuum, the smart maps is a great tool, maps out the entire floor so you can choose which room or area to clean.
customer_reviews.author: otto tapia

customer_reviews.title: Best buy ever!
customer_reviews.text: Used for 3 months, no complaint and this cleaning bot did a wonderful job! My husband and I recommended this product highly to our co-workers and they are satisfied too!
customer_reviews.author: cutefatcat

customer_reviews.title: it gets lost
customer_reviews.text: I've had this Roomba for a number of years now. I've had it replaced under warranty a few times too. The Roomba can get itself stuck and can't get out. It also has trouble getting on the base if the carpet is a bit thick. I tried putting a cardboard under the base so the wheels would be on the cardboard when it went home but it still has trouble getting on the base.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Chamalian

product_meta.title: iRobot Roomba s9+ (9550) Robot Vacuum with Automatic Dirt Disposal- Empties itself, Wi-Fi Connected, Smart Mapping, Powerful Suction, Anti-Allergen System, Corners & Edges, Ideal for Pet Hair, black
product_meta.description: Style:Roomba s9+The Roomba s9+ robot vacuum - our smartest, most powerful robot vacuum yet. The Roomba s9+ automatically empties into a disposable AllergenLock bag that holds dirt and dust - so you don’t have to think about vacuuming from start to finish. The s9+ has a suite of groundbreaking technology designed for a superior clean deep into corners and along edges. Using Imprint Smart Mapping, Roomba s9+ learns, maps and adapts to your home, determining the best way to clean. Battery Type - Lithium Ion.
feature_bullets: CLEANS UP AFTER YOU, AND ITSELF - Forget about vacuuming for months at a time with the CLEAN BASE Automatic Dirt Disposal that allows the s9+ to empty itself for up to 60 days. With the Anti-Allergen System, 99% of pollen and mold allergens are trapped.
OUR MOST ADVANCED CLEAN - You—& your home—deserve the best. With groundbreaking technology & a sophisticated design, the s9+ is our smartest, most powerful robot vacuum yet.

DEEPEST CLEAN - With 40X the suction power, the superior 3-Stage Cleaning System lifts, loosens, then eliminates debris & pet hair from deep within your carpets. Increases suction to clean even deeper into carpets with power boost technology.

DETAILED POWERFUL CLEAN - PerfectEdge Technology with advanced sensors & a specially designed Corner Brush optimize cleaning deep into corners & along edges. Ideal for homes with pets. 30% wider Dual Rubber Brushes don't get tangled with pet hair.

GUIDED BY SERIOUS SMARTS - With vSLAM navigation, the s9+ learns the layout of your home & builds personal Smart Maps, enabling it to expertly clean & navigate in neat, efficient rows. If it’s running low on battery, it recharges & resumes cleaning.

VACUUMS MESSES IN THE MOMENT - Cleaning crumbs is now as easy as “Roomba, clean under the kitchen table.” A simple request to your voice assistant* or via the iRobot Home app enables the s9+ to clean messes for you, right when they happen.

COMPLETE CONTROL OF YOUR CLEAN - With Smart Mapping, your robot knows your kitchen from your living room, so you can decide where it cleans & when. & with Keep Out Zones, your robot knows to avoid sensitive areas like pet bowls or play areas.
A CLEAN UNIQUE TO YOU - The Roomba s9+ robot vacuum is smarter than ever, learning where & when you normally clean & suggesting personalized schedules so you can focus on everything else.
THE DREAM TEAM OF CLEAN - With Imprint Link Technology, the Roomba s9+ robot vacuum & Braava jet m6 robot mop team up to vacuum then mop automatically in perfect sequence.

iRobot does not certify the quality or authenticity of products purchased from non-authorized resellers, and will not cover claims, provide service or offer replacements for products purchased from these sellers.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.9 out of 5 stars873 ratings3.9 out of 5 stars
